text: Sample from a 330ml bottle at True Bearing Alehouse, Xiamen. Pours reddish black with reddish brown head. Aroma of roast malt and chocolate with coffee and a sourish edge. Sour bitter finish. Very nice.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, berries, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts, coffee and tart.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium/large dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, berries, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter, dry and sour sour with roasted malts, coffee and tart.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What an interesting and strange concoction thanks to all those different barrels it aged on. Perfect appearance and a great palate as well. Simply a very unique beer overall.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Really complex aromas of chocolate, cocoa, toffee, brown sugar, and coffee. It all works in a densely-packed and heavy stout. Super, long finish. Delicious.  Really picks up all of the dark fruit, aged, boozy, tannic elements of the barrels in which its spent time.

33 cl bottle served in snifter (which I strongly recommend) . Pours pitch black, no light seems to escape this black hole ale. Tan to tawny head at first is tremendous, bubbly and ever-growing, then diminishes quickly and vanishes almost completely, except for a thin espresso-coloured layer that remains all the time. Aroma is intense, very intense, and full of cask-related scents: smoke, leather, bacon, campfire, tobacco, coffee beans, espresso, cedar bark... Some bitter herbs are present as well, some nuts (mostly walnuts and hazelnuts) and a tinge of orange peel. Mouthfeel is, to begin with, creamy. Man, do I like this oily soft mouth-covering sensation! Carbonation is restricted, of course, but present. Some sweetness and umami and sourness balance the high alcohol contents and the almighty bitterness that make this gigantic yet gentle monster linger long after swallowing, when more and more smoke comes to you. Splendid.

Black with brown head. Brown sugar, coffee, and toffee. Sweet, slick and oily finish.
 Good!

Rami Rami is drinking a Beer Geek Breakfast Brunch Big Blend by Mikkeller at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku

Megazlozone, wanilia chyba wygrywa, ale jakies ziemiste nutki, owocowe, szarlotkowe, drewniane, sporo palonosci, kakao, czeko, kawa, cialo


Rami Rami: Kokos tez jest... kurde... drewno... mega ciekawie to zagralo... takie semislodkie semi wytrawne, bez kwaskowatosci... migdaly...

PS: troche to polezakowalo, ze 3 lata od rozlewu?

February 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Crazy gush bomb annhilitated my suit. Rescued by thumbing the hell out of the neck. BEWARE. As Mikkeller Big Blend, 8%. Black, opaque with a foamy brown head. Aroma is earthy, molasses, chocolate, creamy coffee. Body is smooth, oily with low carbonation. Taste is coffee, woody, rich chocolate. Actually this is very nice considering I thought it would be infected rubbish after the gush. I should give this beer a 1 for what it did to me though. (3.8)

Bottle hauled back from the source about 2 years ago. Black pour with a big tan head, which dissipates and leaves a thin layer. Roasty, coffee, vanilla, cherry/red fruit, and oaky aromas. Taste is pretty damn spectacular - cocoa, vanilla, slightly sweet, a bit of smoke, finishes with a bit of coffee

33cl bottle shared in CW. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. It pours a clean brown color with a large beige head. Massive gusher. Aroma is roasty and chocolatey with notes of wood and chocolate. Taste is also lightly roasty and sweet with notes of chocolate lactose and vanilla. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice enough

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Daniel. Big gusher. Pours oily black with a creamy beige head. The nose holds ashy roast, cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with more baking cocoa, dark coffee, scorched earth. Medium toll bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming finish, some brownies, bittersweet baking cocoa, more ashy roast, burnt marshmallows. Pretty solid.

Thanks to Danny. Crazy explosive gusher! It pours jet black with a thick dark tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee grounds, rocky road, tobacco, light smoke and charred wood. The taste is rich roasted malt, charred wood, tobacco, cocoa, dried fruits, spicy, tannin, wood, earth and some booze with a drying, charred finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Better than the gush suggested. Chewy and heavy duty though.

Bottle shared on Level 42 09/2017. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. A massive fountain gusher. A jet black coloured pour with a dark tan head. Aroma is musty roast, red wine grape, woody roast, milky. Flavour is composed of smooth vanilla, coconut Brown sugars, little musty, bourbon barrel, vanilla. Palate is medium full, milky, lowish carbonation. I like it.
(bottle) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a tall brown head; aroma of roast, milk chocolate, chocolate liqueur; intense, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter sweet flavour

Appearance: jet black with brown fluffy head. Head on this one poured way too high
Aroma: vanilla, burnt coffe notes
Mouthfeel: smooth, medium full mouthfeel, medium high carbonation
Taste: vanilla forefront, coffe, roast malts. Fairly bitter aftertaste 
Overall: great beer to sip nice and slow

Bottle 330ml.
Pours black with high dark brown head. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate. Taste is of coffee, chocolate, acidity, roasted malt. Palate: Full bodied, medium carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Overall: Big gusher. Carbonic acid. Still good.
Bottle to tulip. Coffee and slight chocolate. Near black with big brown head that fades. Taste is bitter chocolate, coffee and tar. A little harsh on the roast.

Randolph Beer, NYC bottle: pours black with a brown head. Aroma is hella lot of coffee, light chocolate with present hoppiness, and some light fruitiness... did not smell too much of the barrels here. Taste is coffee and quite a bit of it. Noce level of bitterness. Some rounded fruitiness. Not too heavy or imperial. Pretty good.

(Gusher) Pours a very dark brown with a high brown head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of coffee, chocolate, light funky "something" (sweaty or maybe leathery) and sour sauce. Taste is of rich fudgy chocolate, light smoke, coffee. Moderately bitter and lightly acidic. Body is full, carbonation high for such a brew and mouthfeel is rich. A cool imperial stout. I just wish the individual barrels would shine a little more.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! (slightly gushing) pours unclear dark brown with a frothy and creamy medium dark beige head, reviving and leaving very nice lacing. roasted raisins, cognac fruits, coffee acidity, red grapes, juicy cherries, dusty wood, integrated coffee beans, bitter chocolate, salt. moderate carbonation - slightly foamy; medium body - oily; sweetish grapes-spicy-woodsy finish. very solid blend - barrel complexity, enhanced fruitiness, very smooth.

Bottle (330 ml), shared. Gusher. Pitch black with a medium reddish-brown head, decent retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is quite complex with features from multiple barrels coming out (Madeira, Sherry, Rhum) with roasted malts, coffee, red fruits and vanilla notes. Taste is semi-sweet with moderate barrel acidity, roasted malts, coffee, red fruits notes, vanilla, chocolatey notes, a bit of alcohol and mild barrel spiciness. Medium body, lighter because of the acidity. Moderate carbonation. Semi-acidic finish with coffee and chocolate. Very complex. The acidity is surprising at first, but its fun because it makes the beer lighter.

13th November 2016Opaque dark brown beer, good dark tan head. Palate is airy, semi dry and has modest fine carbonation. Tangy rich dark malts. Some fruity coffee. Tangy fruits.Touch of dark chocolate. Smooth dry finish. Coffee linger. A rich stout but for me it never really takes off.
backlog tap. Black with a very dence head. Weak palate, balance a bit over the place. Somewhat milky. Meh
Pours black with low tan head. Gushes. Aroma of German sausage, coffee, chocolate. Taste is sweet, roasted and burnt. Body is light and sticky with soft carbonation.
Disappointing. Barest hint of coffee in the aroma and flavor although the barrel aging does come through. Head is huge but fizzy and very short-lived. Body reflects that. Okay finish.

Bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lingering brown head. Aromas of roasted malt, bakers cocoa, coffee, brandy and oak. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of roasted malt, coffee, oak and bakers cocoa with a smooth dry lingering earthy coffee finish.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, coffee, cherries
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

Bottle, I cant remember where from. Lost much of it to excessive carbonation, which is sad. Roasty boozy cherry grape aroma. Big roasty taste with sickly sweet notes, bitter cherry finish. Good but not my favorite Mikkeller impy.
Bottle. This is nice big bold roasted oatmeal stout. The bead developed aggressively. Not sure if it was the bottle I had but seemed to have some issue.

330ml bottle pours out black topped with a fizzy tan head. Nose is barrel sweet malts coffee barrel notes and some spice. Taste is smoke roast malts coffee vanilla barrel and a medical cabinet this is going to be sour infected mess soon.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, chocolate, bourbon, whiskey, cherries, and oak. Very different taste.

Black body with a decent tanned head. Aroma is roasted coffee, vanilla, oak, licorice, dark malt. Taste is malty with a thick body, roasty, chocolate and fudge. Dark fruits in finish with a mild boozy note. The barrell presence is clear in this one, though the different BAs melt into one kind of undefined layer.
Gicle un peu à louverture. Robe noire avec une belle mousse marron. Arômes chocolat, café, fumé. Goût café, chocolat, fruits à coque. Final chocolat. Texture crémeuse. Excellente stout.

330ml bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 24-07-2016.
In short: messy BA IStout.
Pours very dark with nice frothy creamy quite tan head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Coffee, roasty, sherry and creamy nose. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is a blend of many different falvours, not so well integrated.

330ml bottle at home on 25th June 2016: poured slowly into a Chimay badged chalice. Huge tanned head on the black sludge like pour, Coffee, toffee nose and taste, rich, deep bodied with a slight over roasted malt and bitter chocolate feel. Decent, but not as great as some claim.

Black pour, moderate sized tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma of moderate roast, chocolate, caramel, barrel, vanilla, lightly vegetal. Medium bodied, moderate roast bitterness, quite drinkable but *grossly* overpriced @ $11 for a 330ml bottle.

Bottle. Black pour, with a tan head. Burnt coffee, sweetness, fruit, burnt roasted malt, bitter chocolate, and bitter coffee. Sweet and bitter, and somewhat over carbonated, almost fizzy for the style. Ok.

33cl bottle. Gusher!!! Pours almost black with a huge good lasting brownish head. Aroma of dark roasted malt, coffee, liquorice and chocolate. Taste of dark roasted and bitter malt, chocolate, coffee, liquourice, nice!

Poured into a snifter showing pitch black with three fingers of huge latte foam. Gushed a bit out of the bottle. 

The nose shows a mix of sweet forward caramel/molasses notes with roasted coffee and malts. A big nose on this one. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Flavors of heavy roasted malts with a milky latte notes in between and a big roasted malt/freshly roasted coffee bean character finish on the end. Not bad.

Sample at the Mikkeller Tasting at Verkstedet, september 10th 2015. Black body with a decent tanned head. Aroma is roasted coffee, vanilla, oak, licorice, dark malt. Taste is malty with a thick body, roasty, chocolate and fudge. Dark fruits in finish with a mild boozy note. The barrell presence is clear in this one, though the different BAs melt into one kind of undefined layer. Never mind, a very nice beer, as the BGBs usually are.
Bottle from Tall Boys, Leeds. Massive gusher on opening, lost half the bottle. Black colour with a thick tan head. Dark chocolate, and roasted malt aroma, taste chocolate malty and light sweet.
Bottle. Dark brown pour. Gusher. Dense brown head. Coffee and a dry oak note. Good beer.
Black as night, large, brown head. Aroma of stout and chocolate. Heavy body, little bit carbonation. Taste of stout.

Appearance- black and opaque, with a frankly enormous dark brown foamy head. You need to be quick to get this in the glass before it escapes. Aroma- treacle toffee, coffee, dark chocolate, tiramisu, Black Forest gateaux, port, vanilla, oak barrel, boozy cherry and other dark fruit, reasonably booze-heavy, burnt malt, fruit/chocolate cake hybrid. Loads going on here. Taste- cherry skin, coffee beans, fruitcake, bitter dark chocolate, hint of vanilla sweetness, burnt toast, roasted dark malt. Mouthfeel lets it down slightly- its a bit too foamy to bring it all together. Still very enjoyable though.

shared bottle at a bar, gusher alert. poured a dark brown to more black colour with a foamy beige head. nose of sweet bakers chocolate, vanilla, dark coffee, licorice, oak, roast, not a lot of bourbon in the nose, i was expecting a lot more from these 6 barrels. pretty light bodied

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 09.07.2025
Came straight out of the bottle and formed a lot of foam when pouring. Aroma has licorice, alcohol, ash and hayish vichy-like elements. Flavour has stinging alcohol, sweet whisky tones, vanilla and woody notes. Whisky is strong in the flavour side. Nice slow sipper despite all the foaming. Drinkability is not that great though.

330ml bottle from Beergium. Gusher alert. Pours pitch black with a massive foamy brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, vinous notes, wood, oak, hints of cherries, whisky, berries and chocolate. Taste is smooth, roasty and stingy with some coffee, wood, berries and cherries. Finish is roasty, heavily carbonated and stingy with some coffee, wood, oak, mild tartish cherries and chocolate. A bit unbalanced.

---Pisane na podstawie notatek---
Piana ogromna, brązowa, drobnopęcherzykowa  mega gęsta. Nagazowanie za duże choć nie wyczuwalne w smaku. Barwa czarna. Aromat kawy, lekkiej wanilii, whisky, brandy i bourbon.
W smaku whisky stout z kawą, którą silnie czuć przez cały czas. Z początku dosyć słodkie, w chwilę staje się gorzkoczekoladowe i wytrawne. Smakuje dodatkowo mocnymi alkoholami  głównie whisky i brandy. Lekką wadą tego piwa jest bardzo subtelny, ledwie wyczuwalny aromat stajni. Płatki owsiane nadają gładkości. Bardzo dobre choć trudne.
Rundes dunkles etwas zu spritziges bier! Hat beim öffnen leider sofort übergeschäumt! Geschmacklich sehr gut und runder als das beergeek breakfast!

Dark black color with medium fluffy brown head and decent lacing. Aroma is rich, with vinous notes, coffee, and smoky wood. Flavor is very woody at first and finishes with deep dark coffee flavors. Smooth, dark roasted, with a slight bitter dryness and a bit of tart fruits. So much going on, but its good. Insanely expensive at $11/bottle

gushed all over my guests ... dark brown black... thin tan lacing ... soft dry chcoolate roats .. dark malt roast .. dark chocolate ... big chocolate nose ...meaty chocolate roasdt .. soft rich chocolate malts .. rich chcolate malts

At Mrks. Shared bottle, gusher. :-( black with tan head. Very frothy creamy chocolate. Some bourbon some tequila, some wine maybe, coffee, oatmeal, vanilla, light peat. Light sweet, light bitter. Full body, love the mouthfeel, very silky, mocca, chocolate, strong carbonation for the style. Very nice!

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Big gusher, fuck that. Black with big brown head. Coffee, dry cocoa powder, some sour berries, toast, ash, cognac, very light peat. Light sweet and medium roasted bitter. Medium bodied with a bit dry feel and full carbonation. Decent aroma bit shitty body and fuck this being a gusher.

12oz bottle pours a watery, deep brown/black with LOADS of foamy, dark brown head. Uh oh... smells infected! Six barrels in one blend, infection should probably be expected. Nose has a lot of tree bark, soil and charcoal, some bread crust, some brown sugar, burnt caramel. Flavor is a little better, theres more malt and cracker than the nose lets on, better barrel character too with some char, caramel, a little soy, lots of earthy notes late with soil and tree bark. Full bodied, earthy finish. Nothing special, a bit messy actually.
Over rated like most mikkeller beers. This one smells medicinal and some oats. Pours over carbonated and overflowed the glass. Taste is bitter and dry and medicinal. Something wrong here.

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur noire avec une fine mousse brune qui tient convenablement pour une BA - Au nez des aromes vineux, du cuire, de bois, légèrement vanillé, café, réglisse, pointe de chocolat, fruits rouges et fruits secs - En bouche toujours vineuse, café, chocolat, réglisse, bois, terreux, mal rôti - Corps moyen/lourd, amertume moyenne/forte, carbonations correcte, sèche et légèrement acide, final café amer avec un début dacidité - Un corps trop léger dommage, le blend est intéressant, mais je reste un peu sur ma faim

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Gusher! Foam party! Large ass brown foamy head. 
Aromas wood, berries, roast, earthy, alcohol, wood roast, perfume, chocolate and cacoa...
Flavours of sherry, cognac, cacoa, earthy, hoppy, chocolate, perfume, wood roast, oak roast, chalk, liquor... More and more, quite complex.
Aftertaste is roast, chalk, cacoa, chocolate, hops and wood roast.
Low to medium carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Good stuff, shame of the gusher, but the rest is absolutely ok!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Thompson. Opaque pitch black color, full sized brown head that lasts for quite a long time. Aroma is malts, some roast and some coffee but I dont really get a lot of barrel aging. Taste malts, some roast, oak barrel, light barrel tart hints, some liquorice, some coffee hints, liquorice bitter. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle @ benzai... large dense off-white head... black colour all the way... smell cocoa coffee bitter... taste cocoa bitter really strong coffee...

Flaska från Beergium. Svart, tung vätska med mörkbrunt skum. Intensivt syrlig kafferost i inledningen med smulig choklad, kakao, körsbär, bourbon och kola i bakgrunden. Även en del mintlakrits och chili. Kroppen åt det tyngre hållet, bubblig, men inte lika tung som de andra i beer geek-serien. Kaffebeska, sötsyrlighet, soja och bourbon i smaken.

Bottle from Mikkeller SF. Poured black with thick tan head. Apparently over carbed. Aroma soapy detergent cherry. Light carb med bod. Tastes better. Too much going on, choc roast hints of random spirits.

Bottle.

A- Coffee, roasty, subtle bitterness, dry, subtle boozy cherry.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Roasty, bitter, dry, coffee.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- This was a big gusher. Luckily I saved most of it. For all the different barrels its aged in you dont get a lot of it. A bit of spiciness from the tequila and some cherry from the bourbon and whiskey otherwise not much. Tons of roasted bitter notes otherwise not all that exciting really. Left a really sugary stickiness on the glass.
Dark opaque brown, mahogany, minimal tan head. Darker fruit coffee, cherry, some lacto and molasses sweetness. Light anise. Quite bitter, decently sweet. Heavy oily body, very long finish. Excellent.
Aroma is chocolate, fruit/barrel funk and dark malts/earthy. The flavor is dark malts, barrel funk, dark chocolate and big acidity and sour in the finish.

On tap at Mikkeller and friends. Pour is close to black with a huge tan head. Aroma and flavor of coffee grounds, cocoa, booze, a bit of dark fruit, and a bit of sour mash. Finish is oily, coffee bitterness, and burnt wood.

On tap 0,25l at Milkeller, Copenhagen. Pours a black colour with big brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little bourbon and a little vanilla. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little vanilla, medium sweet, hop, little liquoirce, little over carbonated, little cocoa beans and medium bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A black beer, a head is huge and light brown. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roastiness, pine, citrusfruits and salt liquirice. Delicious. Taste has roastiness and espresso, citrusfruits, salt liquirice, lots of hops are used, balanced sweetness. Medium+ bodied, strong carbonation. The hops are quite strongly presented, at least when the bottle is propably fresh (bbe 2025). Mix of six barrels, but none of them are not noticed. Tasteful beer, the great aroma.

12 oz. bottle, pours jet black with a humungous tan head (that cant be right). Aroma brings out lots of wood, with a slight bourbon quality, followed by feint coffee and oats. Flavour is quite harsh, with loads of bitter roasted malt dominating upfront, with secondary notes of coffee, and further back, oats. Only get a touch of wood, but its not a barrel-heavy beer. More just getting harsh roast notes, which leaves a rather abrasive astringency on the finish. Mouthfeel is a tad thin. Something seems a touch off-base here, what with the towering head, harsh roastiness and thin mouthfeel (compared to other Beer Geek Breakfast versions). Still, good, but not one of the better ones in the series. And at $12+, this is a rip off for the quality.

Pours like a shaken bottle bomb. Gushed all over the place and then gushed out of the glass. This shouldnt happen. Appereance is jet black with a 4 inch head and a stained desk. 

Aroma of roasted malts, bitter hops, plastic, chocolate. Not really getting any barrel character here at all. Maybe some tequila, but its very faint. As it warms, I get a little bit of wine barrel.

Chocolate dominates the taste, little bit of coffee in there too. Not much else. The mouthfeel is so carbonated its hard to dig in to this, its prickly on the tongue and drys away faster than it should. 

Bang for buck ratio, this is possibly the worst mikkeller beer ive purchased. I had high hopes, and wanted it to be good to make up for it gushing all over my desk. Avoid this and stick to their single barrel releases.

11.2 oz bottle shared with the group. Pours dark brown to black in color with a large tan head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, wood, the different barrels blend with hints of each coming through as it warmed, in my opinion, the whiskey character and some fruity notes come through more, some oatmeal sweetness, overall good, but some of the individual pieces are better.

(Bouteille): Le liquide était très pressé de sortir de la bouteille et une fois les bulles dissipées, on a droit à un corps assez mince. Beaucoup de tabac, de petits fruits, vanille, épices et anis à différents niveaux. Par moment, on croirait boire un porto diluer dans un cendrier. Un peu bordélique mais divertissant.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a small dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, residual sugar and light cherry notes is quite rich and complex. Taste is a good mix of bourbon, vanilla, cherry light oak and quite bit of residual sugar notes. Body is full enough for style with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Pretty much and over the top though retains enough drinkability. I am not sure I would need to have this on a regular basis but interesting nonetheless.

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Pours a deep black hole black with a finger of brown foam that lingers. Big roasted cacao notes with some roasted coffee, toasted molasses and some light vanilla. Creamy and rich on the palate with a full-body. Lots of cacao nib and espresso bitterness on the palate. Wow. Very complex for the abv. The flavors keep unveiling new layers as the beer warms. Long, dry and roasty finish that lingers. Very good.

Jet black pour with a huge espresso head. Over carbonated, and almost a gusher. Aroma of deep roasted coffee and lots of vanilla barrel notes. Thin mouth. Flavor has hints of roasted grain, but overall the flavors are kind of muddled. Pretty dry. Not much barrel character in the taste. A little lace present.

Best by 9/7/27 enjoyed January 4, 2016 in a Mad Elf tulip/snifter.

Look - This EXPLODES. I poured this cold beer (right from the fridge) down the edge of the glass and it still wasnt contained. It quickly filled the snifter so had to pour the rest in to a 24 oz glass. The head has very thick bubbles. It does not die down quickly. Body is dark brown with a light red tint. 

Smell - There is the smell of a a highly carbonated wheat beer. Once you get by that there is chocolate, coffee, fruit, raisin, wine, etc (a lot). 

Taste - Wheat. Coffee. Dark chocolate. Red wine. Char. 

Feel - I can already feel it coming back up in belches. Doesnt sit well. No alcohol taste just super bubbly. 

Overall - I had very high hopes from this. I was wondering how it could be better than the other varieties. I cant get by the explosive head and feel.

Bottle. Overcarbed, look out for small gushing. Huge head, big bubbles, black. Aroma of liquor from barrels, stout notes not present. In taste nice roastines, light acidity, barrel and liquor notes medium sweet. Finish is slightly acidic and medium bitter. Medium body, too high carbonation a bit harsh on palate. In overall overhyped beer, single barrel aged beer are much better, even normal Beer Geek Breakfast is better.

Draught at Mikkeller Tokyo. Surprisingly deep and complex for the abv, yet very smooth and heady with a lovely dry finish. Quite impressive stuff despite not being much of a Mikkeller-head in general.

Bouteille bf 09/07/25. Mini gusher qui a laissé quelques gouttes sur mon bureau , liquide brun foncé une mousse intense, crémeuse. La levure danoise est ma première perception au nez, vient ensuite du chocolat, des grains. Il semble fermé. La bouche est correct avec des saveurs de café, du lait, de moka. Rien dextraordinaire. Une finale un peu trop amère pour mon palais. Sensation dalcool fort en prime.

Black pour with a lot of foamy tan head and lots of sticky lacing .... aroma of roasted malts, coffee, oak, dark chocolate and dark fruity yeast .... taste is sweet and of dry oak, roasted malts, coffee, dark fruity yeast and a dry bitter hoppy bite on the back end and into the finish .... a bit lively on the tongue and was a pretty foamy beer .... I prefer the regular beer geek brunch better

Many layers to this one. Drinks like an 11 or 12 percenter. All the classic impy flavours with a smooth, luxurious body. The amount of barrel flavours is phenomenal. Classic stuff and a great sipper. Tap.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2015 On tap at Mikkeller Tokyo pitch black with a lovely coffee nose and the flavor is coffee and surprisingly perfumey with an almost gin like character to it while you get barrel in the finish. Really good stuff, smoothly put together and easy to drink.

Bottle. Beer geek big gush? This gushed all over for some reason. Pours black with a huge brown head. Aroma of a dark malty base, coffee, weak barrel notes, some vanilla, coffee and roasted malts. The taste has some green coffee, cocoa, roasted malts, dark sweet malts and very weak barrel notes. A bit of a mess i guess but the delicious coffee saves it a bit.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured black color and an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy dark chocolate malt and coffee aroma. Medium to full body with with a smooth rich texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted dark coffee flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good complex beer.

Jouvre cette bouteille et le liquide se répand. Deux bonnes gorgées sur le comptoir. La mousse qui sinstalle est gigantesque. Le nez de café, davoine, de caramel, de fruits et de chocolat exhibe aussi des parfums de bourbon, de tequila, de cognac, de chêne blanc. Tout ça est très appétissant. Les saveurs des différentes barriques prennent le contrôle. Le boisé est multiplié tandis que la base de la bière cherche à reprendre son souffle. En bouche, le corps est huileux et le pétillement est relâché. La finale se fait principalement sur des notes de tequila et des notes amères noires.

11.2oz bottle thanks to alexsdad06 for sharing. Last bit from the bottle in my glass. Near-black color, thin brown head. Leaves loose bits of lace. Nice dark chocolate, touch of dark fruit, some coffee, nice wood, but mild liquor notes. Medium to bigger body. Decent chewiness, lighter carbonation. Mild dry finish. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, lighter sweet. Pretty roasty. Less on the barrels than expected, but a solid oatmeal stout.
sampled @ 2de Bierproeffestival van De Dijleschuimers. Pours black, small grey head. Smell is bit bitter, coffee. Taste is sharp, intense bitterness. coffee, dark chocolate. Rather thin. Ok

Make sure you have your glass nearby and are standing over the kitchen sink, because this beer is insanely carbonated. Pours a dark, creamy, opaque brew, with an insanely tall, frothy, espresso-dark head with good retention. It looks amazing. The smell is quite nice, too - bourbon, whiskey, tequila, dark chocolate, cocoa and, of course, coffee. The taste is blander than I expected, sharp bitter with notes of brewed coffee, dark chocolate and some dry liquor, like gin or tequila.

For all their differences, the Bjergso share a mutual desire to push the boundaries of (dark) beer to ridiculous extremes. Evil Twins Bozo included a long grocery list of added ingredients and (allegedly) tasted great. Big Blend seems to be the answer to that mode of thinking. The other Bjergso brothers brew is a blend of six barrel-aged beers. Big Blend? More like big understatement. For all its diverse influences, Big Blend ends up smelling like a focused Oatmeal Stout. Theres the usual notes of cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, licorice, and just a bit of alcohol-soaked cherry. Big Blend is technically the most beautiful Stout Ive seen. Extremely heady - especially given the high gravity. Dark pour and chocolate-colored suds. Flavors of bittersweet chocolate, fresh coffee, cream, and subtle dark fruits. Feel is rich, full, smooth. This is an extravagant beer.. and an expensive one. Its worth it, though. After all, breakfast is the most important drink of the day.

Bottle, 8%. Mikkeller#500. Black with big brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little bourbon and a little vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little vanilla, medium sweet, hop, little liquoirce, little over carbonated, little cocoa beans and medium bitter.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with a huge dark brown head. Way overcarbonated. Definite gusher. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Taste is moderately bitter with nice sweet backbone. Flavors of coffee, chocolate, toffee, caramel, dark fruits, oats, bourbon, maple syrup. Excellent stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at The Festival 2015 in St. Petes with Vin. Pours a deep blackish brown body with thick head. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of sharpie marker, soy sauce, chocolate, oak and bitter coffee roast. Decent stout, but I get a ton of sharpie marker/soy sauce.
Pours the part if a stout with a humungous big foam head. Solid coffee notes, bourbon, cognac. Wild full body, booze burn.

Bottle at home, gusher. Pours black with a big dark beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, malt, coffee, oak barrel notes, booze, licorice, cognac, light whiskey notes and overripe dark fruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Above medium bodied with a moderate and not too pleasant carbonation. Something a little wrong with this one with the gushing and over carbonation but still decent in aroma and flavour although overboard on blending a bunch of beers together. Give me a plain brunch weasel any day..

Tap @ Mikkellerbar Aarhus. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, complex as shit - very nice. Black with big tan head, lasting. Moderate sweetness, malt bitterness. Full body, thick texture, light carb., malt bitter and sweet finish.

Aroma is a lot like Expedition stout; tons of licorice, roasted malt, barrel, cocoa, dark fruit, fresh coffee, sweet and bitter. Appearance is black and thick, brown head, looks great. Taste is blended for sure. Its got the sweetness of a bourbon county and the robust flavor of an Expedition Stout. Sadly, they balance each other out and nothing stands out. Starts with dark fruit, like plum, figs, raisins, moves into deep roasted malt, licorice, and coffee. Mouthfeel is thick, soft carbonation and oily. Overall, Im on the fence here. It has so much potential but in the end, it just does not stack up.

Tap. Black body and an average, lacing and creamy, brown head . Aroma of roasted malt, wood, chocolate and coffee. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and flat to soft carbonation. An excellent Stout. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Shared bottle, this one was alive. Pours is dark with big persistent brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, malts, bourbon, light coffee. Solid malty background, lot of chocolate on tongue, some acidic notes, light sweet, medium bitter. Medium to heavy body, oily to creamy texture, coffee, cocoa aftertaste and long bitter finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. 281115
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, vegetables, coffee and hops.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with huge, bit foamy deep tan head. Gusher. Aroma of coffee, wood, raw sugar, red wine, light chocolate, licorice, oat meal, dark fruits, vanilla and toast. Taste is very light sweet (expected it to be way sweeter!) and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, bitter chocolate, oak, cocoa, bourbon, light vanilla and light ash. Full bodied with low to high, spritzy carbonation. Overall, pretty nice. Im guessing this has fermented in the bottle a bit, as it gushed, was dryer than both of the base beers and surprisingly highly carbonated. I prefer both Breakfast and Brunch, non barrel treated, to this. Still, could be worse.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en Belmonte 12..11..2015. (r67). Lote ML14:40 8 hasta 09..07..2025. Color negro intenso con bastante espuma oscura. Sabores iniciales licorosos frescos bastante indefinidos al inicio, entre Tequilas y ligero bourbon. Final con buenos toques de cafés y algo de cacao y especias. Bastante buena aunque suena bastante a experimento. Sabor Bastante indeterminado por la gran cantidad de barriles aún así para repetir sin duda.
Tasting session at Budapest Only Good Beer Pub. Roasted malty and woody with coffee, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted with coffee.

Bottle from Capitol zbeer & Tap Room. Pours near blackbwith a massive tan head and a chocolate and coffee aroma. There is a complex flavor that includes dark molasses, coffee, wine and cognac. Very tasty.

Bottle. Gushed like a lil bizh! Pours pitch black with a big mocha head. Aromas of malt, hard bitter roast, light barrel notes, sherry, savory, dark fruits, dark chocolate, licorice. Taste is roasty, malty, sherry, dark chocolate, licorice, some cognac-like notes, dry.

Bottle. Gushing like crazy!!! Pours a pitch black with a huuuuge, bubbly brown head. Aroma is extremely roasty, coffee, slight hoppy, slight caramel, dark chocolate, very little barrel character, but subtle hints of cognac and whisky. Taste is dry, roasty, dark chocolaty. Had this earlier, and i imagine that the sweetness it used to have has turned into gush in this one. Very high carb, medium full body.
Bottle from Geers.Pitch black, lots of dark brown foam. Light gusher. Very roasty with notes of coffee, ashes and wood. Bitter and dry, Light boozy. Good.

330 ml bottle shared in Ockelbo, thanks Alexis! Gushed like crazy, half the bottle on the table... What was left was black with coarse tan head. Aroma has lovely coffee notes, chocolate, mild barrel notes, sweet malt and mild fruity berry notes. Taste is rich and complex and very well balanced. Milky chocolate, coffee, smooth roasted notes, barrel, wood, booze and some fruit. Very nice.

12 oz bottle. Thanks to RobertDale. Heard it might gush, so I slowly cracked and it gushed as soon as the cap was loose. Poured a few oz out in one glass to reduce the pressure. Then poured 6 oz into a 12oz snifter and the head nearly overflowed. 5 min later resides to a quarter inch of tan mocha head over pitch black body. Head has odd finger size spots of dark bubbles over tan like looking at a leopard. Smell is like an espresso powder. First sip is very dry coffee. Very dark euro malt. Some dark fruit, fig and raisin. Id be lying if I said I could pick out any barrel in this. I guess its just kinda muddled together into a bit of oak buried in there. 

Very fizzy, foamy mouthfeel. Almost like I need to decanter the stuff for an hour.

33 cl bottle.
Pours jet black color with a huge beige head, didnt require any extra help coming out from the bottle, no serious gushing though. Aroma is bursting with coffee and cocoa, roasted malts also, very subtle chocolaty notes. Flavor is chocolaty and quite burnt malty, ashy even, wooden notes, faint tar there, subtle coffee. Very bitter and dry palate. Nice and refined but I lack to see the point of multi-barreling here.
3424

Bottle from hop hideout, Sheffield. on opening the bottle fizzed over and I lost over half, not happy at 8 quid a bottle! What I could salvage was pitch black with particles and a tan head. Aroma is chocolate and rich strong dark roast coffee, get some whisky and rum flavours too. Taste is rich and bitter, quite boozy. Thick and oily, mild tingly carbonation. What was left was nice, shame I had to mop up most of it.
Bottle - pours black tan head - nose and taste of brandy, chocolate, cherry wine, tequila, oak, toasted oats - med body

Almost completely black with frotheng light brown head. Aroma of gunpowder and candy store but also some cooked vegetables and citrussy. Interesting and original aroma but not exclusively good aroma. Sadly a bit overcarbonated leaving a sparkling sensation which disturbs the taste. Taste is mostly bitter coming mostly from the alcohol. Not overly sweet. Burnt malty finish.

Almost completely black with frotheng light brown head. Aroma of gunpowder and candy store but also some cooked vegetables and citrussy. Interesting and original aroma but not exclusively good aroma. Sadly a bit overcarbonated leaving a sparkling sensation which disturbs the taste. Taste is mostly bitter coming mostly from the alcohol. Not overly sweet. Burnt malty finish.

Lets start with the minus points - fizzed all over the place on opening and I lost at least a third of the bottle. Shouldnt happen. But everything else is good. Thick and black with a dark brown head that, maybe because of the explosive elements, stays around until the end. Very full body. The barrels bring a vast array of elements to the nose, with the cherry particularly prominent alongside the coffee and dark chocolate. The fruit, wood and dark toffee builds up in the mouth as the coffee gets milkier. Complex, tasty, great.

Stout day. Bottle. The beer is black, very black. The head is light brown and grows prodigiously with each pour. It just keeps bubbling up and up. Interesting. The aroma is creamy with good chocolate and a big mish mash of barrel flavors. The barrel flavor is fruity, oaky and a little smokey. Theres really just all sorts of things going on. Vanilla, cherry, caramel, smoke. Taste is moderately sweet. It could use a bit more of that smooth sugariness, really. Lots of barrel flavor, but the base is strong and holds up to it. Big oak. Fairly big body, could be chewier. Solid stout, but there are better entries in the Beer Geek series.
33cl bottle. Super dark color. Head is medium and brown. Body is medium, somewhat sticky. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is super super chocolate, coffee, liquorice, light vanilla.
This exploded out of the bottle , not sur why,as it had been in my cellar for a month. Full on cocao notes on the nose, with a big booze hit. Not as good as the other beer geeks.

Sampled at the Festival, pours dark brown with medium to larger head. Notes of bitter coffee, whiskey, chocolate, and light dark fruit. Body is on the thicker side. Finish is nice and bitter. Solid stuff form Mikkeller

Grosse mousse dense qui samenuise assez vite. Nez alcoolisé avec des notes de fruits confits. Pas si gourmand que ça en bouche et dune certaine netteté ... Mévoque certains Whisky assez frais. On est pas trop dans la café ou chocolat à limpact "brutal". cest finalement assez délicat

Sampled @The Festival in Florida. Aroma: roasted coffee, woody. App: dark brown, no head. Taste and palate: medium to full body, medium sweetness, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. Overall: great! Nice bitter finish.

16-OCT-2015, bottle @home, from Mikkeller & Friends.
Gusher. On the floor and the table. 
Huge head off course. Brown og black body. It does smell and taste like a big blend. Messy. Not not-nice but messy. Lots of cognac, whiskey. A lot of that fine roasted coffee stout as well. Huge carbonation, a little sweet, almost full body. Quite nice.

Bottle tall boys beer market leeds. Jet black great tan head looks amazing. Nice dark roasty malts dark fruits molasses ina aroma and taste lots of oaky flavours cherrys molasses. Nice body. Good stuff allround.

330 ml bottle from Mikkeller Webshop.
Black body, with a big, creamy, moderately lacing, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of various barrel notes, like bourbon or cognac, dark chocolate, molasses, coffee, vanilla, some liquorice, some red and dark fruits, subtle mint like freshness.
Taste starts (a bit too) sweet and thick, with sweet barrel notes, chocolate, molasses, vanilla, sweet fruits, again some spicy mint like notes, but merges into enjoyable, more dry and roasty notes, like wood, tobacco, cocoa, coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice, also dark fruits.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium bitter, dry, with wood, coffee, cocoa, liquorice, some barrel notes, subtle alcohol warmth.

Interesting, but somehow chaotic. The beer changes a lot during drinking and takes different directions over and over. Drinks pretty smooth though. Overall a bit too unbalanced compared to other Beer Geek variants, the blending is just too obvious, but still enjoyable stuff.

Black color with dark brown head. Aroma has a fresh, hoppy character and also milk chocolate. Taste follows with the chocolate note and whiskey. Definitely on the bitter side. Body is quite heavy but also has a high carbonation. Good overall but I dont think the blend works as good as the single barrel aged variants.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate roasted malt, coffee, light-moderate dark chocolate, dark fruits/cherry, light wood/oak, bourbon/whiskey, and a touch of vanilla. It pours a dark brown, virtually black, with no transparency and a very large tan head with good retention. After it finally settles there is some thick soapy webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate dark chocolate. There is some dark fruits and cherry in the middle. The finish has moderate black coffee, roasted malt, pine, wood/oak, hints of vanilla, and maybe bourbon. Its medium-full bodied with light-moderate carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel. Overall, outside of the cherry wine, I cant pick up on most of the other barrels...maybe bourbon, but its really light.

Bottle from Beerhive. Pours black with big dark brown head, in fact tried to come out of the bottle on its own. Nose is bitter and roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, oak, some booze. Palate is fizzy and surprisingly thin, tastes chocolate, coffee, tequila cognac or some other strong alcohol, apple. Quite thin, fizzy and messy. Obviously mixing everything is not so good idea. Expected way more.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Comes black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, and whiskey. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, whiskey, chocolate, vanilla, and wood. Nice, but was expecting more.
Bottle at home, gusher. Pours black, nose is chocolate, coffee, little soapy, taste is dry, roasted, thick, bitter, coffee, some oak.

How: Draught.
Where: Mikkeller & Friends (Stefansgade), Copenhagen.
Appearance: Black colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, liquorice, coffee, dried fruit.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, some alcohol.
Bottle at tasting. Oily pour. Aroma of coffee, cacao and mixed booze. Rich taste of cherry, ripe fruit, chocolate, cream, tequila and lots of barrel notes. Bit messy, but really taste nonetheless.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours black with large frothy tan head. Aroma of mocha, roasted malts and a nondescript spirit. Thick, viscous body with dark chocolate at the fore. Difficult to pick out each barrel influence. There is an oakiness with fleeting glimpses of a boozier nature, but I really expected more. A big disappointment in that regard but a delight to drink nonetheless.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma light smoke, roast, oat, Vanilla, burbon, cherry. Taste is roast, cherry, coffe, bitte roast. Over carbonation. With a bit a work, you can make it good.
330ml bottle from beer hive. Light gusher. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of coffee, light tar, wood, some apple notes. Taste is dark chocolate, more apples, very gassy. Ok.

duft: virkelig kraftig duften øl. kaffe ristet malt sprit. kaffe. chokolade. lidt soja
smag: ristet malt kaffe chokolade. ristet smag. kan til slut af sprit og brændt. lang eftersmag .
Bottled:A gusher. Pours black with a large head. Roasted aroma with notes of licorice, coffee, red wine and smoked ham. Roasted flavour with notes of oak casks, coffee and red wine.A bit messy.
Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen 19/9-15. Roasted malty with a lot of coffee, also some woody notes. Body is medium to full, the finish is roasted with coffee.
Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen 150919. Roasted malty and woody with coffee, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted with coffee.
Tap @ mikkeller & friends. Pours a black as night beer. A lot of coffee in both aroma and taste with some woddy notes. Dry finish
Bottle. Pours opaque black with a creamy brown head. Loads of roasted malts with notes of oak, coffee and ash. Ashy and roasted flavor. Some sour off notes. Oak and wood. Bit disappointed.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Pitch black - offwhite head. Coffee. High barrel. Light acid. High burned malts. Grapes. Salmiac. Dark chocolate. Gunpowder. Light body in the finish. Nice.

Keg at Leeds International Beer Festival 2015. Took a million years to pour, very foamy and lively. Gloopy, snot-like consistency. Incredibly thick, lively mouthfeel giving it even more milkshake-like tendencies. Super strong coffee, vanilla, dusty closet, peat, brown sugar, cognac. Dee-lish.

Bottle @ Voldby øl-messe. Gusher that pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, rich coffee, cocoa, sweet milk chocolate, whisky, wood, light vanilla. Flavor is light sweet, malts, caramel, cocoa, chocolate, wood, vanilla, whisky, little alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol. 290815
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, coffee, pepper, and chocolate - with a bitter and roasted finish.

Pours black with a lasting, active tan head. Aroma is whisky, coffee, earth, molasses with a very slight hint of chocolate. Taste is coffee with a heavy taste of whisky and quite prominent alcohol. Slight hints of chocolate and liquorice coming through. Overall a well balanced beer but slightly heavy on the alcohol/spirit taste.

Bottle, shared at Brewda 2015 by whoever... Small sample. Black color. Beige to brown head. Aromas of whisk(e)y, roasty, red fruit. Retronasal more roast, a bit less whisky, some coffee sourness. Flavor is roasted, light sour, moderate bitter. Rather strong alcohol feel. Medium to full body. Finishes with ground coffee, roast.

Fra fat på ØST, sammen med Odd Gunnar og Egil sep-15: brunsvart med fint, beige skum. Mye og god aromaog smak av mørke malter, mørkbrent kaffe, vanlije og noe lakris. Mer portvinspreget og lettere i kroppen enn de BGB-versjonene (bourbon og brandy ed.) vi hadde på Cardinal noen dager tidligere, men så måler da disse på 10,9 på Richters skala!.

Keg. Leeds International Beer Festival. Nearly black. Thick, bubbly, lasting, tan head. Looks great. Woody, chocolatey, charred bitter. Bit of treacle. Bit minty. Taste is rich, charred bitter. Treacle sweet. Soft, lightly tart palate. Finishes long, tart, woody bitter.

On tap at Øst, Stavanger. Pours almost pitch black with some tiny bubbles on top. Aroma is malty, with tar and liquorice. Taste is moderate sweet dark malty, weak roasted, with liquorice, light tarish notes, vanilin and weak smoke. Long lasting, very good, 
.

Keg at Mikkeller and Friends CPH, Day 3 of RBESG 15, 22/08/15. 
Pitch black topped with a dirty tan head.
Nose is rich roast, charr, spice, earthy hop tones, liqourice, coffee.
Taste comprises tangy dark fruits, coffee grinds, cocoa, light booze tunes, charr, roast malt, subtle barrel.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a gentle boost.
Solid gear, good balance and drinkability.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle @ CBC 15 frivillig fest. Pout is pitch black with a tan head. Lots of roast, coffee, some soy sauce, chocolate, vanilla with some oaky notes.
33 cl. bottle. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, spice, caramel, licorice, chocolate and bitterness.
Bottled. A black with dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, and bread. The flavor is with notes of roasted malt, coffee, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle at yespr. Black with a medium sized dark brown head. Nose is a good mix of hops and malts with green plants, citrus, roasted malt chocolate. Flavour is mostly malty with wood, vanilla, roasted malt, green plants, molasses, coffee. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium/heavy sweet and bitter. Long malty finish. Big, sticky, good.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Black pour with beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, with some chocolate, caramel, coffee, nice dark fruits, great smooth mouthfeel, sweet to roasty finish.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a dense brown head. Aroma is dark malty and solid fruity. Coffee and light herbal. Dry, roasted, dark malty and rich chocolate. Smooth coffee and light herbal. Dry and roasted dark malty finish.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody coffee chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty woody coffee and chocolate finish.

Bottle. Black body with large tan head. Aroma is coffee sweet roasted malts with vanilla and some wood in the background. Taste is roasted malts some dried fruits with some wood, some sourness and hints of vanilla. Aftertaste is medium bitter balanced by some nice sweetness.

Az előzetes információk alapján a világ egyik legjobb sörével lehet dolgunk a Big Blend személyében, legalábbis ha a Beer Geek-alapot, s azt vesszük számításba, hogy bourbon-, brandy-, meggybor-, konyak-, tequila- és whisky hordók szolgáltak az érlelés alapjául. Ami a fajsúlyát illetően némi kétkedésre adhat okot, anélkül, hogy alaposabban megismerkednénk a sörrel, az az alkoholtartalom, mely a maga 8 százalékával talán nem a legdurvább mérték, amit valaha címkére vetettek, s egy efféle formátumhoz talán nem is a legmegfelelőbb keret, már ha az exkluzivitását adó hordóérlelések rendszerinti velejárójából indulunk ki alkoholfok terén. Mindemellett azt is le kell szögeznünk, hogy ez esetben "csak" egy stoutról van szó, s ebbéli tulajdonságánál fogva talán soha nem is lesz annyira tökéletes alany az érleléshez, mint egy vérmesebb imperial stout. Ezen az úton kell tehát elindulnunk feltérképezése során. Küllem tekintetében semmi esetre sem okoz csalódást, olajos teste szemet gyönyörködtető módon folyik ki az üvegből. Az illatok terén a különböző érlelések kavalkádjában tévedhetünk el, talán ez esetben beigazolódni látszik a mondás, miszerint a kevesebb néha több. A különböző alkoholok kusza keverékének képe szövődik ki óvatosan, ha választanom kellene, leginkább a szárazabb, sherrys és tequilás aromák telepszenek rá a kávés illatgörgetegre. Olyan selymes és krémes a test, amennyire csak lehetséges, az ízrobbanás azonban ez esetben elmarad. Nem az a desszertszerű jelleg - letisztult, füstös és pörkölt stílusú a karaktere. Idővel egyre jobban kinyílik, így a bourbon kókuszos, vaníliás aromái is érvényre jutnak illatában is, s ahogy kortyolgatjuk, úgy lesz egyre nagyobb mélysége a kezdetben követhetetlen struktúrának. Zamatos, krémes, sziporkázó alkoholok elegye teljesedik ki idővel, s az utolsó kortyok felé haladva - kissé finomítva álláspontunkat - egyre inkább díjazzuk az értékeit.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo webshop, Earlsdon, Coventry consumed at home Friday 21st August 2015with dad on the screeding the office floor w/e.  Pours black with a volcano like beige head, very lively. Thick in the mouth, really quite tangy and fruity, the BA is noticeable and leaves a woody beerprint and light boozy edge over this beer. I am not sure that I would pick out any particular variant of the BA which I guess is intended as the blend does seem to ensure that no one BA takes over another. However all in all I am a bit disappointed Mikkeller make some great beers but this isnt one, £8.95 is quite a lot for a beer that doesnt really do it for me. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov12 3.3
Pitch black colour; great, brown head. Lot of coffee and chocolate in aroma. Also roastd notes, vanilla, wood. Strong roastness in taste, chocolate, coffee some sourness from barrel.
pours pitch black with a fine brown head. light coffee aroma, light smokey, aromas, taste medium bitter light sweet notes. full bodied, average carbonation. light bitter finish

Did a mistake - tasted after Struise Black Albert IMP.. Tho Beer geek definitely wasnt brought to knees by that. Nice roasted smooothness, feels superbly balanced, dark choco, coffee,
BA presence. Moderate sweetness with moderate bitterness. Very nice indeed
@ Mikkeller & Friends, København 15-8-7: Småtrevlig men med lite mediokra kaffetoner och fat. Något tunn

330-ml bottle from mikkeller beer club. gushed, unexpectedly, on opening. big beautiful coffee-colored head. intense complex ashy roasty bitter with sweetness from barrels ("bourbon  brandy  cherry wine  cognac  tequila  whisky"). chocolate finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is cold brewed coffee, roasted malt, liquorice root, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, a tad too thin texture compared to the style, soft carbonation. Finish is mostly coffee, roasted and a little warming alcohol.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. 

Black with a small tan head. Sweet with light roasted malt, chocolate, some coffee and hints of alcohol. Not a bad one but sweet and not the best in the series.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Pitch black colored with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of alcohol and chocolate.
Sweet and roasted flavor of chocolate and alcohol.
Roasted and warning alcoholic finish.
